node.html: Developed a U-Net model for segmenting 3D cardiac MRI images, focusing on the left ventricle, right ventricle, and myocardium. The project utilized the Automated Cardiac Diagnosis Challenge (ACDC) dataset for training and evaluation, achieving accurate anatomical segmentation (approximately 88%) to aid in computer-aided diagnosis of cardiac conditions. Implemented using PyTorch and Monai, with preprocessing, model training, performance evaluation, and visualization of segmentation results.

Classified dermoscopic images of skin lesions into eight diagnostic categories to support early skin cancer detection. Utilized a dataset of 25,331 images with metadata, applying data augmentation, modified ResNet for segmentation, and advanced feature extraction techniques.

Analyzed daily electricity consumption data in France (2013-2023) using statistical methods, including mean and variance estimation, Gaussian model evaluation, Bayesian analysis, hypothesis testing, and confidence intervals.

Implemented Dynamic Decision Trees from scratch, focusing on building and optimizing tree structures that adapt based on real-time input data. The algorithm dynamically adjusts its decision-making paths to improve accuracy and efficiency, enabling more effective handling of complex, non-linear datasets.
Implemented the ACE algorithm for unsupervised image color correction, combining global and local equalization techniques based on human vision.
Developed a mobile chess app using Java and Android Studio to learn and apply object-oriented modeling concepts, featuring interactive gameplay and user-friendly interface.

Developed a "Quick Draw" game using the Quick, Draw! dataset by Google, where a neural network was trained to recognize hand-drawn sketches. The game prompts users to draw specific objects, and the model attempts to correctly identify the sketches based on the training data, providing instant feedback to players.

Developed a decision support information system for analyzing employment trends in Canada across various sectors, featuring a dashboard with visualizations of official government data to improve decision-making and long-term forecasting.
Containerized application components using Docker and Kubernetes, enhancing scalability and reliability, and utilized the EFK stack for effective monitoring and logging.

Set up a multi-node Hadoop cluster for storing and analyzing large volumes of unstructured data, using both virtual machines and Docker containers to create a distributed computing environment for efficient data processing and management.
Designed and implemented a chess game, focusing on game mechanics and interactive gameplay features.
Built a clone of Eventbrite using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Node.js, featuring event creation, user registration, and ticketing functionalities.
Developed a browser-based pathfinding visualizer using JavaScript and ReactJS to demonstrate algorithms like A*, Dijkstra, and Depth-First Search in a game-like environment.
